author: P Pavan
title: Flipkart cheating case: Family of five to go behind bars
text:
Investigations reveal Amazon too was duped for Rs 16 lakh
​ The case of cheating of online ecommerce portal Flipkart by a Hyderabadi youth for over Rs 20 lakh misusing its 'reverse pick-up policy' has taken a new turn with the police naming all other four members of his family as accused. While the main accused, Pulagam Veera Raghava Reddy alias Veera Swamy, is already in jail, the other four will be arrested soon. The Vanasthalipuram police also discovered that the family had cheated another leading online ecommerce portal Amazon too for Rs 16.17 lakh in the same way.
According to police, Veera Reddy, 25, used to place orders for electronic goods, mostly INTEL processors in the name of himself, wife Naga Lakshmi, mother Sita Rathnam, brother Ramachandra Reddy and his wife Sindhura. When the items are delivered by Instakart, the courier agency of Flipkart, the family would remove an important component from the item or wholly replace it with a duplicate item perfectly maintaining the model number and item code and demand the Flipkart to take it back as the item delivered was of substandard. Thus, he booked more than 200 items in the last 20 months and returned many of them. He would sell the The Flipkart management realized it very late in Sept and conducted probe on its own, before lodging a compliant with the police. The ecommerce company and its courier agent grilled several courier boys and found them innocent.
The next clue the company got was that all the reverse pick up demands were from the same area. Thus, the company kept a watch on Veera Reddy and caught him red handed when he returned a processor in September third week. The company lodged a complaint with the Vanasthalipuram police (under Cyberabad commissioinerate limits) on Sept 30 and also handed Veera Reddy to the cops.
LB Nagar deputy commissioner of police Tafseer Iqbal said Veera Reddy had admitted to having duped Amazon also on the same lines. Amazon said in its complaint that it had incurred a loss of Rs 16.17 lakh.
Veera Reddy family had spent Rs 10 lakh out of the total 37 lakh. "We have frozen the bank accounts of all the family members. All the accounts together have a balance of Rs 45 lakh", the DCP said.Assistant commissioner B Bhaskar Goud said all the other accused would be arrested in a few days. A total of 120 SIM cards of various mobile service providers were seized from Reddy's family.
Veera Reddy's father Satyanarayana Reddy died a few years ago. The family originally hails from East Godavari district and settled in Hyderabad. He works as a computer mechanic in the city. He was using the INTEL processors stolen from Flipkart in his original business.
